summary: This document is an inventory list of boxes containing legal materials related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, including documents from the Jane Doe v. Epstein and Jane Doe v. U.S. litigation, plea negotiations, grand jury materials, victim information, and investigative files. It reveals the extensive scope of legal proceedings, evidence collection, and negotiations surrounding Epstein's prosecution and the subsequent civil cases.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the criminal and civil cases. The inventory includes documents related to his prosecution, plea agreement, and civil litigation.

persons.context: Mentioned in correspondence folders, indicating legal communication related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Lefcourt is listed as an attorney in extensive correspondence related to Epstein's case, indicating he was part of Epstein's defense team.
Black is mentioned in correspondence regarding the NPA and attorney's fees, indicating defense representation.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, was involved in the plea negotiations and correspondence regarding the non-prosecution agreement.
Extensive correspondence between Sanchez and Acosta is noted, indicating close collaboration in the prosecution/negotiation of the Epstein case.
Correspondence between Starr and Acosta is noted, indicating Starr's advocacy to Acosta regarding the case.
Correspondence between Sloman and Lefkowitz is noted, indicating legal discussions or negotiations.
Cassell is identified as sending letters on behalf of victims, indicating his representation of them in litigation against the U.S.
Brunel is listed in a research folder, indicating an investigated connection to Epstein.
Wexner is listed in a research folder, indicating an investigated connection to Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Plea Agreement Finalized
events.description: The inventory references the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) and plea agreement drafts, indicating the finalization of the controversial plea deal in 2008.

events.title: Plea Negotiations
events.description: Extensive correspondence and folders document the plea negotiations between Epstein's defense team and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Operation Leap Year Grand Jury Presentation
events.description: The inventory includes a folder for the "4/29/2008 Grand Jury Presentation for Operation Leap Year with Indictment," indicating a key step in the federal investigation.

events.title: Motion Hearing in Jane Doe Case
events.description: A transcript of a 6/12/09 motion hearing in the Jane Doe v. U.S. case is listed, indicating ongoing civil litigation.

events.title: Hearing in Jane Doe Case
events.description: A transcript of an 8/14/08 hearing in the Jane Doe case is listed among the documents.

events.title: Final Victim Notification
events.description: A "7/10/2008 Final Notification of Identified Victims" is listed, indicating the government's formal identification and notification of victims in the case.

events.title: Settlement Conference
events.description: A 5/16/2016 settlement conference summary letter to Judge Dave Lee Brannon is listed, indicating ongoing settlement negotiations in the civil cases.

keyFacts: The inventory reveals the massive scale of documentation generated by the Epstein prosecution and related civil litigation, spanning at least 24 boxes.
It details the extensive plea negotiation process between Epstein's high-powered legal team (including Starr, Black, Lefcourt) and prosecutors (Acosta, Sanchez, Sloman).
The list includes sensitive materials such as grand jury transcripts, victim information lists, flight manifests, and victim settlement documents.
It shows evidence of research into Epstein's associates, including Jean-Luc Brunel, Robert Maxwell, and Leslie Wexner.
The inventory documents the parallel civil litigation under the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) brought by victims (Jane Does) against the U.S. government.
